medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent, painless swelling of the lower lip and notable tongue edema with a scrotal appearance.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms have been present for 1 year. The patient has reported seven episodes of facial nerve palsy occurring since he was 17 years old. Previous treatments with topical and oral corticosteroids provided only partial benefits and temporary improvements.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of celiac disease and atopic diathesis. Seven episodes of facial nerve palsy since age 17.
